DOC.brief_summary: CCTG 595 open-label clinical trial effect text message intervention vs. standard care adherence Truvada PrEP MSM increase risk HIV infection ( ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier : NCT01761643 ) . Eligible subject match case control substudy receive vitamin D 4000 IU/day 24 week , week 24 week 48 . In CCTG 595 , plasma participant collect stored entry every 12 week . These plasma sample use measure P1NP , CTX , PTH , vitamin D level case control entry , week 24 , week 48 .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Vitamin D Supplementation Bone Turnover Markers During PrEP MSM
DOC.detailed_description: A total 50 HIV-uninfected men sex men ( MSM ) male female ( M F ) transgender individual already enrol CCTG 595 offer participation sub-study Week 24 main study . All subject enrol sub-study provide Vitamin D 4000 IU/day supplement addition PrEP Weeks 24 36 ; clinic visit proceed normally per main study protocol . Upon completion sub-study subject continue main study . The primary endpoint , bone turnover marker , measure Week 24 Week 48 via plasma sample collect main study . Concurrent control enrol vitamin D substudy report supplementation < 400 IU vitamin D/day match 1:1 randomization arm CCTG 595 main study ( text message arm vs. standard care ) , age ( ± 5 year ) , race/ethnicity , season study entry , BMI ( ± 3 kg/m2 ) .
DOC.criteria: All subject must meet CCTG 595 inclusion criterion . All subject must meet CCTG 595 exclusion criterion . Current prior use bisphosphonate therapy . Current use Vitamin D supplement great 400 IU/day . Current use androgenic hormone growth hormone . History nephrolithiasis ( kidney stone ) . History fragility fracture . No use tenofovir prior entry CCTG 595
